latest news.eng_title: Sinquefield Cup Gukesh draws with Giri Praggnanandhaa holds Caruana
latest news.summary: At the Sinquefield Cup, Alireza Firouzja of France won the Grand Chess Tour with one round to spare, securing a USD 100,000 bonus. He played out the longest game of the day, which ended in a draw after 80 moves against Ian Nepomniachtchi of Russia. Firouzja's tally of 5.5 points out of eight games is unassailable, and he will win the tour for the first time, even if he loses his final bout against R Praggnanadhaa of India. Praggnanadhaa drew with Fabiano Caruana of the USA in 28 moves. Alireza Firouzja noted, 'It's very tough to win a tour. Any tour is tough to win, but this is the strongest tour in the world. Very happy, but it's very tiring and feeling exhausted but, I'm very happy.' The third place is still shared by five players on four points apiece, including Gukesh, Praggnanadhaa, Vachier-Lagrave, So, and Abdusattorov.
latest news.title: Sinquefield Cup Gukesh draws with Giri Praggnanandhaa holds Caruana

latest news.summary: The 9th round of the Grand Chess Tour's Sinquefield Cup in St. Louis, USA, is underway. Fabiano Caruana (USA) is playing against Anish Giri (Netherlands), while Alireza Firouzja (France) is facing Rameshbabu Praggnanandha (India). Nodirbek Abdusattorov (Uzbekistan) is playing against Jan Nepomniachtchi (Russia), and the other matches are between Gukesh Dommaraju (India) and Wesley So (USA), and Maxime Vachier-Lagrave (France) and Ding Liren (China). The current standings are: Firouzja - 5.5, Caruana - 4.5, Abdusattorov, Vachier-Lagrave, Gukesh, So, Praggnanandha - 5, Nepomniachtchi, Ding Liren - 3.5, and Giri - 3. The time control is 90 minutes for 40 moves, then 30 minutes until the end of the game plus 30 seconds per move starting from the first move.
latest news.title: Grand Chess Tour. Сент-Луис. 9-й тур. Непомнящий сыграет с Абдусатторовым, Фируджа против Прагнанандхи, другие партии

latest news.eng_title: 2024 Sinquefield Cup round 8: Firouzja Clinches Grand Chess Tour, Eyes Sinquefield Cup
latest news.summary: Alireza Firouzja has clinched the 2024 Grand Chess Tour after a fighting draw against Ian Nepomniachtchi in round 8 of the Sinquefield Cup. Firouzja needs a draw in the final round to secure the Sinquefield Cup title. Fabiano Caruana trails by a point and must win against Anish Giri to have a chance at the title. Other players, including Praggnanandhaa, Abdusattorov, Vachier-Lagrave, and Gukesh, are tied for third place and will compete for the remaining spots. Firouzja explained his strategy in the game against Nepomniachtchi, saying, 'I decided to go for it. Yea, I could play something else and probably make a draw without any fight. I wanted to keep more game in the position.' Meanwhile, Ding Liren explained his decision to accept a draw against Abdusattorov, saying, 'I thought I might be slightly worse... It looks like I played good moves, but I didn't evaluate well.'
latest news.title: 2024 Sinquefield Cup round 8: Firouzja Clinches Grand Chess Tour, Eyes Sinquefield Cup

latest news.eng_title: Grand Chess tour Gukesh holds Caruana; Firouzja consolidates lead
latest news.summary: In the seventh round of the Sinquefield Cup, Alireza Firouzja of France extended his lead by a full point after defeating world champion Ding Liren of China. Fabiano Caruana of the United States drew with Grandmaster D Gukesh of India, while R Praggnanandhaa of India also drew his seventh game in a row to remain on a fifty per cent score. Firouzja now has five points, a full point ahead of Caruana, who is in second place. With just two rounds remaining, Firouzja is well-positioned to win the tournament. As Firouzja said, 'The Italian opening has been doing well for me, and I was able to knock down a couple of pawns when Liren erred in the middle game.'
latest news.title: Grand Chess tour Gukesh holds Caruana; Firouzja consolidates lead

latest news.eng_title: Fiyuzda Takes the Lead in the Sinquefield Cup 2024
latest news.summary: Alirezza Fiyuzda has taken the lead in the Sinquefield Cup 2024, winning 3/4 games in the last four rounds and pulling ahead of his closest pursuer Fabiano Caruana by a single point. Jan Nepomniachtchi has suffered two losses on the same distance, while Nodirbek Abdusattorov has secured his first win in the seventh round. Maxim Vachier-Lagrave has also made a notable streak, achieving 24 draws in a row in classical games across several tournaments. The eighth round will begin on Tuesday, August 27 at 21:00 MSK. Fiyuzda said, 'This is a very tense tournament because it's the last one in the series. Everyone has their goals. Wesley and Maxim are fighting for third place, and the rest are playing for the win.' Fiyuzda has been dominating the tournament, beating Anish Giri in the fifth round after Giri made a mistake on the 42nd move. Fiyuzda said, 'I calculated seven moves ahead, but I didn't notice that I could checkmate him two moves later.' Fiyuzda has also praised Din Li Zhen's performance, saying, 'I was happy when his time ran out, and I wasn't surprised when he yawned. He had a very passive position.' Fiyuzda has won against the world champion, and the eighth round will see him face Nepomniachtchi, while Abdusattorov will play against Din Li Zhen. The Sinquefield Cup 2024 is the final event in the Grand Chess Tour 2024 series, with a prize fund of $350,000.
latest news.title: Кубок Синкфилда 2024: Фирузджа отрывается от преследователей

latest news.eng_title: Grand Chess Tour: Gukesh holds Caruana; Firouzja in lead
latest news.summary: In the seventh round of the Sinquefield Cup, Alireza Firouzja of France stretched his lead to five points after defeating World champion Ding Liren of China. Fabiano Caruana of the United States drew with Indian Grandmaster Dommaraju Gukesh, while Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa of India drew his seventh game in a row to remain on a fifty per cent score. Firouzja now has a full point lead over Caruana, who is in second place with four points. The other Indian in fray, Praggnanandhaa, is tied for third place with Gukesh, Vachier-Lagrave, and Abdusattorov on 3.5 points each. As the tournament nears its end, Firouzja's victory has given him a significant advantage, and he will look to maintain his lead in the final two rounds. According to Firouzja, 'The Italian opening has been doing well for me, and I knocked down a couple of pawns when Liren erred in the middle game allowing me to invade his camp.'
latest news.title: Grand Chess Tour: Gukesh holds Caruana; Firouzja in lead

latest news.eng_title: Grand Chess Tour: Eighth Round Pairings Announced
latest news.summary: The Grand Chess Tour is set to begin its eighth round in St. Louis, USA. The matches for the day include Rameshbabu Praggnanandha (India) vs. Fabiano Caruana (USA), Jan Nepomniachtchi (Russia) vs. Alireza Firouzja (France), Ding Liren (China) vs. Nodirbek Abdusattorov (Uzbekistan), Wesley So (USA) vs. Maxime Vachier-Lagrave (France), Anish Giri (Netherlands) vs. Gukesh Dommaraju (India). The current standings are: Firouzja - 5, Caruana - 4, Abdusattorov, Vachier-Lagrave, Gukesh, So, Praggnanandha - 3.5, Nepomniachtchi, Ding Liren - 3, Giri - 2.5.
latest news.title: Grand Chess Tour. Сент-Луис. 8-й тур. Непомнящий сыграет с Фируджей, Со встретится с Вашье-Лагравом, другие партии

latest news.eng_title: 2024 Sinquefield Cup Round 7: Firouzja Beats World Champion, Grows Lead to Full Point
latest news.summary: GM Alireza Firouzja defeated GM Ding Liren at the 2024 Sinquefield Cup, increasing his lead to a full point with two rounds to go. Firouzja's plan worked like clockwork, as Ding released the tension in the center due to time-pressure miscalculation. Firouzja reflected, 'I was very happy because he was getting low on time... It was not a surprise that he blundered. It's a very difficult position to have over-the-board.' Meanwhile, GM Nodirbek Abdusattorov scored his first classical victory of the GCT, defeating GM Wesley So with a combination of strategic and tactical ideas. Abdusattorov's preparation reaped rewards, and he shared his mindset during the game: 'At this point, I was very confident with my position, but, you know, we saw many, many kind of saves this tournament, unbelievable saves.' The Sinquefield Cup will continue with round eight on Tuesday, August 27, at 2 p.m. ET / 20:00 CEST / 11:30 p.m. IST.
latest news.title: 2024 Sinquefield Cup Round 7: Firouzja Beats World Champion, Grows Lead to Full Point

news knowledge.summary: The Sinquefield Cup, the final leg of the Grand Chess Tour, saw several exciting matches in the third round. Alireza Firouzja of France and Ian Nepomniachtchi of Russia share the lead with two points each, while six players, including Dommaraju Gukesh and Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa, are tied for third place with 1.5 points each. Gukesh survived against Praggnanandhaa, drawing a lost endgame, while Nepomniachtchi had a relatively easy win against Anish Giri. Fabiano Caruana scored his first victory of the tournament against Nodirbek Abdusattorov, and Alireza Firouzja got lucky against Maxime Vachier-Lagrave. The event has a total prize pool of USD 3,50,000 apart from the Grand Chess tour bonus prize fund of US$ 1,75,000.
news knowledge.title: Chess: Gukesh survives against Praggnanandhaa

news knowledge.eng_title: A Taste of Gukesh vs. Ding at the Grand Chess Tour Finale
news knowledge.summary: The 2024 Sinquefield Cup, the final event of the Grand Chess Tour, is set to begin on August 19. The tournament will feature a star-studded lineup, including world champion Ding Liren, challenger Gukesh Dommaraju, and other elite players. Gukesh, the youngest world championship challenger in history, will face Ding for the first time since becoming the challenger. Ding has a 2-0 lifetime lead against Gukesh in classical games, including a victory at Tata Steel earlier this year. The Sinquefield Cup will provide a sneak peek into the upcoming world championship match in Singapore in November. Meanwhile, Alireza Firouzja has taken the lead in the GCT standings after winning the Saint Louis Rapid & Blitz, and Fabiano Caruana will battle Firouzja for the GCT throne. The tournament will feature a $350,000 prize fund and a single round-robin format.
news knowledge.title: A Taste of Gukesh vs. Ding at the Grand Chess Tour Finale

news knowledge.eng_title: Alireza Firouzja's Comeback: From Disappointment to Victory
news knowledge.summary: The Saint Louis Rapid & Blitz tournament, held from August 12 to 16, 2024, was the fourth stop on the Grand Chess Tour. The tournament consisted of a nine-round rapid and an 18-round blitz section. In the rapid section, players received two points for a win and one point for a draw, while in the blitz section, wins were worth one point and draws half a point. The top three players after the first three days, each playing three rapid games with 25 minutes of thinking time and 10 seconds of increment per move, were Jan Nepomnjaschtschi, Alireza Firouzja, and Maxime Vachier-Lagrave, who scored 11 out of 18 possible points. They were followed by four American players, including Lewon Aronjan, Wesley So, Hikaru Nakamura, and Leinier Dominguez, who scored 9 points each. Fabiano Caruana, the 31-year-old defending champion, and Nodirbek Adusattorow scored 8 points each, while Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa trailed behind with 4 points. In the blitz section, Firouzja took the lead after the first nine rounds and maintained it until the end, scoring 23 points and securing $40,000 of the $175,000 prize fund. Nakamura climbed to third place in the overall standings with 19.5 points, while Aronjan and Vachier-Lagrave finished fourth and fifth with 19 points each. Nepomnjaschtschi fell back in the blitz section and shared sixth and seventh place with Caruana, who scored 18 points. The bottom three players were Adusattorow, Dominguez, and Praggnanandhaa, who scored 16, 15.5, and 12 points respectively. Firouzja's victory puts him in contention for his second Grand Chess Tour title after 2022. The 22-year-old Firouzja, who was born in Bābol, Iran, and lives in Chartres, France, surpassed the ELO rating of 2,800 in 2021 as the youngest player to do so. In recent years, he has also been involved in fashion design and has gained attention for his extravagant outfits. The chess goddess Caissa rarely forgives lack of dedication to the game, but it seems she has now blessed Firouzja with success.
news knowledge.title: Von der Schachgöttin begnadigt

news knowledge.eng_title: Yan Nepomnyashchy's Disappointing Performance at Grand Chess Tour
news knowledge.summary: Russian grandmaster Yan Nepomnyashchy won only one of the nine blitz games at the final day of the fourth stage of the Grand Chess Tour in St. Louis, USA. Nepomnyashchy defeated US representative Leinier Dominguez Perez, but drew against Americans Wesley So and Levon Aronian. He lost to Indian Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa, Hikaru Nakamura, and Fabiano Caruana of the US, Nodirbek Abdusattorov of Uzbekistan, Maxim Vachier-Lagrave, and Alireza Firouzja of France. Alireza Firouzja was the only winner of the tournament, earning a prize of $40,000 for his performance.
news knowledge.title: Непомнящий выиграл одну из девяти партий в блиц на этапе Grand Chess Tour

news knowledge.eng_title: 2024 Saint Louis Rapid & Blitz Day 5: Firouzja Wins STL Rapid & Blitz, Seizes GCT Lead From Caruana
news knowledge.summary: GM Alireza Firouzja won the 2024 Saint Louis Rapid & Blitz tournament with two rounds to spare, securing the lead in the Grand Chess Tour. Firouzja led the event throughout the last day, with a convincing performance that echoed his success in the same tournament in 2022. GM Wesley So finished second, while GM Hikaru Nakamura rose to third place with a win against GM Praggnanandhaa Rameshbabu in the final round. Firouzja said, 'I'm feeling very happy. It's a very good feeling to play in this club, and I'm going to enjoy the rest of the days. I'm looking forward to the Sinquefield Cup. [Leading the GCT] matters a lot. The most important tournament of the year is probably the Grand Chess Tour. I'm looking forward to winning it.' Nakamura also shared his perspective, saying, 'Unfortunately, disaster struck in the sixth round when I lost a very messy time scramble against Leinier Dominguez from the United States and I followed this with another loss against Levon Aronian who completely outplayed me in the middlegame in the third to last round. Chess is still painful part two.' Despite this, Nakamura recovered with a win against Praggnanandhaa in the last round, securing third place. The final battle for the GCT crown between Firouzja and GM Fabiano Caruana will take place at the Sinquefield Cup.
news knowledge.title: 2024 Saint Louis Rapid & Blitz Day 5: Firouzja Wins STL Rapid & Blitz, Seizes GCT Lead From Caruana

news knowledge.eng_title: Grand Chess Tour 2024: Nothing changes for Praggnanandhaa, Firouzja leads
news knowledge.summary: The Saint Louis Rapid and Blitz chess tournament has reached its final day, with Alireza Firouzja of France leading the pack on 17.5 points. Firouzja has a 1.5-point lead over Wesley So of the United States and Ian Nepomniachtchi of Russia. Praggnanandhaa of India remains at the bottom of the table with 6.5 points, despite winning a couple of games in the blitz section. So was the star of the day, winning six games and drawing two, but Firouzja is still poised to win the crown. If he does, he could even overtake Fabiano Caruana as the leader of the tour with just one event remaining, the Sinquefield Cup, starting on August 18.
news knowledge.title: Grand Chess Tour 2024: Nothing changes for Praggnanandhaa, Firouzja leads

news knowledge.eng_title: 2024 Chess World Championship: Ding Liren and Dommaraju Gukesh to Face Off
news knowledge.summary: The 2024 Chess World Championship is set to take place from November 20 to December 15 on the island of Sentosa in Singapore. The tournament will feature Ding Liren, the current world champion, and his challenger, Dommaraju Gukesh. Gukesh, a 17-year-old Indian, won the FIDE Circuit 2023 and secured his spot in the championship. The tournament will follow a unique format, with the winner being the first player to reach 7.5 points. If no winner is determined after 14 games, a tiebreaker with reduced thinking time will be held. The thinking time for the first 40 moves will be 120 minutes, followed by 60 minutes for the next 20 moves, and 15 minutes for the rest of the game, with 30 seconds added per move from move 61 onwards. Ding Liren, who is defending his title, said, 'I am looking forward to the challenge.' Gukesh, on the other hand, is aiming to become the youngest chess world champion of all time. The path to the championship was paved by six players who qualified through the Schach-Weltpokal 2023, the FIDE Grand Swiss, and the FIDE Circuit. The other participants in the championship include Jan Nepomnjaschtschi, Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa, Fabiano Caruana, Nicat Abasov, Santosh Gujrathi Vidit, Hikaru Nakamura, and Alireza Firouzja.
news knowledge.title: Schach-WM 2024: Modus, Spielort, Teilnehmer, Rekordsieger

news knowledge.eng_title: Caruana Wins Superbet Chess Classic Romania in Thrilling Tiebreaker
news knowledge.summary: Fabiano Caruana won the Superbet Chess Classic Romania tournament after a thrilling tiebreaker. He finished with 5/9 points, tied with Alireza Firouzja, Rameshbabu Pragganandha, and Gukesh Dommaraju. Caruana won all three tiebreaker games against his opponents, including a crucial win against Firouzja. The tournament saw a high number of draws, with 38 out of 45 games ending in a tie. Caruana said in an interview, 'Maybe we played a bit boringly, but at least the final was exciting.' Firouzja acknowledged his defeat. The tournament was part of the Grand Chess Tour 2024, which took place in Bucharest from June 26 to July 5.
news knowledge.title: Бухарест 2024: Каруана побеждает на тай-брейке

news knowledge.eng_title: Firouzja Beats So, Joins Gukesh, Praggnanandhaa In 2nd Place
news knowledge.summary: The Superbet Chess Classic Romania resumed after a rest day, with GM Fabiano Caruana maintaining his lead after drawing with GM Ian Nepomniachtchi. GM Alireza Firouzja joined GMs Praggnanandhaa Rameshbabu and Gukesh Dommaraju in second place after defeating GM Wesley So. The games of GM Nodirbek Abdusattorov vs. GM Anish Giri and GM Maxime Vachier-Lagrave vs. GM Gukesh Dommaraju also ended in draws. The tournament will continue with the seventh round on July 3.
news knowledge.title: Firouzja Beats So, Joins Gukesh, Praggnanandhaa In 2nd Place

news knowledge.eng_title: Caruana Sole Leader, Back To World #2 After Beating Deac
news knowledge.summary: Fabiano Caruana is back to being the number two in the world with a 2800+ rating after beating Bogdan-Daniel Deac in the Superbet Chess Classic Romania. Praggnanandhaa Rameshbabu and Gukesh Dommaraju are tied for second place. The tournament was visited by Garry Kasparov, who made the ceremonial first move in the game between Alireza Firouzja and Gukesh. Kasparov emphasized the importance of preserving classical chess, saying 'The preservation of classical chess, I think, is very important for helping players to realize their full potential, to put on display what they can do.' Caruana explained his winning strategy, saying 'It's a very tricky kind of modern line.' Praggnanandhaa's win over Anish Giri was due to a single move, 19.b4!, which put Giri in trouble. Ian Nepomniachtchi and Wesley So drew, while Nodirbek Abdusattorov and Maxime Vachier-Lagrave also drew. The tournament continues with the fifth round on Sunday, June 30.
news knowledge.title: Caruana Sole Leader, Back To World #2 After Beating Deac
